title: 3 dead, 9 injured in shooting at a home in Long Beach, California, fire department says
text:
Three people were killed and nine others were injured in a shooting in Long Beach, California on Tuesday, according to the Long Beach Fire Department.

The incident occurred around 10:45 p.m. at a residence on 7th Street, according to the Long Beach Fire Department.

It was unclear if a suspect was taken into custody, or what the motive of the shooting was.

Visit Insider's homepage for more stories.

Three people were killed and nine others were injured in a shooting in Long Beach, California on Tuesday, according to the Long Beach Fire Department.

According to LBFD, firefighters responded to a shooting at a residence on 7th Street in Long Beach at around 10:45 p.m. local time. Three adult men were killed in the incident, while 9 others were transported to the hospital with injuries, according to LBFD.

According to Jake Heflin, public information officer at the LBFD, the scene is still "under investigation."

It was unclear if a suspect was taken into custody, or what the motive of the shooting was.

This is a developing story.
description: The incident occurred around 10:45 p.m. local time. Information about the suspected shooter or a possible motive was not immediately made available.
